title: Eqjs chapter 3
message:
When multiple bindings have the same name the code will only see the innermost one. Variables inside a block of code will take precedent over a global variable with the same name

each local scope can see all the local scopes that contain it

with arrow functions when there is only one parameter you can omit the parenthesis

Each code block creates a new scope and parameters and variables declared in a given scope are local and no visible from the outside.
